metadata.citation: Lu et al. (2015). 'DSSR: an integrated software tool for dissecting the spatial structure of RNA.' Nucleic Acids Res., 43(21):e142 [doi:10.1093/nar/gkv716].

notes.Aminors: A-minor interactions (including types I and II)

notes.Cstem_index: stem index of the 'Canonical' helix in k-turn

notes.Cstem_pair: Cstem bp delineating the k-turn internal loop

notes.Dp: perpendicular distance of the 3' P atom to the glycosidic bond

notes.NCstem_index: stem index of the 'Non-Canonical' helix in k-turn

notes.NCstem_pair: NCstem bp delineating the k-turn internal loop

notes.Uturn: U-turn of the UNR- or GNRA-type

notes.atom_pair: symbols of the two atoms involved in an H-bond

notes.baseSugar_conf: conformation of base related to sugar (syn or anti)

notes.coaxStacks: coaxial stacking of stems within a helix

notes.donAcc_type: donor/acceptor type of the atom pair in an H-bond

notes.epsilon_zeta: difference between epsilon and zeta torsion angles

notes.helix: defined by base-stacking interactions, regardless of bp type and backbone connectivity

notes.nonPair: two nts not forming a pair, but with H-bonding/stacking interactions

notes.nonStack: nucleotide not involved in stacking interactions

notes.oArea: overlap areas between two bases, including exocyclic atoms

notes.oArea_ring: overlap areas between two bases, including only ring atoms

notes.phosContacts: H-bonding and atom-capping interactions involving a phosphate

notes.residue_pair: types of the two residues involved in an H-bond

notes.ssSegments: single-stranded segments not involved in loops

notes.ssZp: Z-coordinate of the 3' phosphorus atom with reference to the 5' base plane

notes.stem: helix consisting of only canonical pairs, with a continuous backbone

notes.str_id: structure identifier, derived from inpfile with extension removed

notes.vert_dist: vertical distance from an atom to a base plane

auxfiles.name: dssr-2ndstrs.ct
auxfiles.desc: secondary structure in connectivity table format

auxfiles.name: dssr-torsions.txt
auxfiles.desc: backbone torsion angles and suite names
